comments:
Hello,

I tried to import files via FTP wizard from an SFTP based server. Following
exception occured.

I am using:
- Eclipse 3.1M6
- WST 1.0.3
- Klomp SFTP plugin
- Sun JVM 1.4.2_03
- Windows XP SP2

Will FTP and WebDAV support also secure connections ? No hint in help.

Bye, Jochen

It does not have anything to do with connecting to a server. The rror happened
while saving the authorization database (a.k.a. keyring) locally.

I believe you do, but just as a sanity check: do you have permission to create a
file under the following location?

d:\Programme\Java\Eclipse-3.1M6\configuration\org.eclipse.core.runtime\

Also, this can be caused by the file being left open (by a different
thread/process) Does it always happen (after exiting/restarting Eclipse,
restarting Windows)?

Another cause would be a corrupted file system.

Yes, I do jave rights for the file.
I forgot to mention:
- I am using CVS plugin, using an "ext" connectoion method, using putty
("plink.exe") as tool for tunneling through a SSH server to the CVS server.
- this connection will always be used, probably same time due to a background sync

There are currentyl about 6-7 files (not online now) in
d:\Programme\Java\Eclipse-3.1M6\configuration\org.eclipse.core.runtime\ :
- some files ending with a ".1"
- and ONE file named ".keyring" (without a ".1") extension

It happened first time.

Hope this helps, Jochen

Again: Will Eclipse 3.1M6 support SFTP or SCP based Team support ? That has been
the reason for trying to connect to a SSH based box.

As far as I know, Eclipse 3.1 does not support SFTP or SCP.  I think you're
asking the wrong place though.  Try the eclipse.platform newsgroup.

I tried to reproduce the error, but didn't get it again.
Please close the bug.

Ok. Please comment here if you see it again and reopen if you can reproduce.

For the records: this can be caused by the file being left open (by a different
thread/process) or a corrupted file system. Note that
Platform.getAuthorizationInfo() does not acquire any locks whhen reading/writing
the keyring file.
